title: Recreation and leisure
creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
brief_description: Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to appreciate the benefits of recreation and leisure, learn how to develop a recreation and leisure program, develop the skills to instruct residents and learn how to evaluate the success of the program. Accompanied by 31p. in-service training manual. At the conclusion of this program the “No excuses. Life. Be In It” advertisment targeting people with disabilities and featuring an amputee, deaf person and paraplegic is screened.
